fields.name: agreement
fields.body_en:
USER AGREEMENT

Please read these terms and conditions before accessing or using ECOLEX

1. General. This User Agreement sets forth the terms and conditions of a license for you to use ECOLEX. By accessing and/or using ECOLEX, you consent and agree to comply with all of the terms and conditions of this User Agreement. The rights and obligations concerning use of ECOLEX in accordance with this User Agreement are personal to you or to members of your household and are not transferable to any other person or entity. From time to time, these terms and conditions of use of ECOLEX may be modified. Accordingly, please continue to review the terms and conditions whenever accessing or using ECOLEX, since any use by you after any such changes, modifications, or additions shall be governed by this User Agreement.

2. Usage. ECOLEX contains copyrighted material and/or other proprietary information and thus, are protected by intellectual property agreements and copyright laws and regulations worldwide. You are hereby granted a license to use, download and print the materials contained in ECOLEX solely for non-commercial purposes and in accordance with this User Agreement, provided that you do not alter or remove any copyright symbol or other identification concerning authorship of any of the materials contained on or otherwise made available to you in ECOLEX. FAO, IUCN and UNEP and their licensors are the sole and exclusive owners of all right, title and interest, including trademarks, copyrights, trade names, trade secrets and other intellectual property rights, contained in the data and software of ECOLEX. Except as may otherwise be expressly permitted any copying, browsing, redistribution, publication, or commercial exploitation of any material contained on or otherwise made available to you on ECOLEX is strictly prohibited. You may make one back-up copy of the data from ECOLEX for your own personal use; however, you may not otherwise copy, modify, adapt, reproduce, translate, reverse engineer, or decompile any aspects or parts of the ECOLEX.

3. Sub-license. All forms of sub-licensing, reselling, republication or other forms of redistribution of any of the data or software used in ECOLEX, including Internet posting, electronic mailing, faxing, archiving in a public data, redistributing via a computer network or in printed form, to any third party, are strictly prohibited.

FAO, IUCN or UNEP may deny you access to all or part of ECOLEX without notice if you engage in any conduct or activities that FAO, IUCN or UNEP believe violates any term of this Agreement.

4. Disclaimer of Warranty; Limitations on Liability. NEITHER FAO, IUCN OR UNEP OR THEIR AFFILIATES, OR ANY OF THEIR RESPECTIVE EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, THIRD-PARTY CONTENT PROVIDERS, OR LICENSORS WARRANT THAT ACCESS TO AND USE OF ECOLEX WILL BE FREE FROM INTERRUPTIONS OR FREE FROM ERRORS, NOR THAT ANY INFORMATION ACCESSIBLE FROM OR RELATED TO THE DATA IS FREE OF VIRUSES, WORMS, OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS; NO WARRANTY IS MADE AS TO THE RESULTS THAT MAY BE OBTAINED FROM USE OF ECOLEX, OR AS TO THE ACCURACY, RELIABILITY, OR CONTENT OF ANY INFORMATION OR SERVICE PROVIDED THROUGH ECOLEX.

ECOLEX IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT ANY WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF TITLE OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MARCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL FAO, IUCN OR UNEP BE LIABLE TO YOU OR ANY OTHER PERSON FOR ANY LOSS OF BUSINESS OR PROFITS, OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF ANY USE OF, OR INABILITY TO USE, ECOLEX EVEN IF FAO, IUCN OR UNEP WERE PREVIOUSLY ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, OR FOR ANY OTHER CLAIM BY YOU OR ANY OTHER PERSON.

You further expressly acknowledge and agree that information, text, graphics, and hyperlinks provided to you through ECOLEX and located on other sites throughout the combined global electronic networks known as the Internet and the World-Wide-Web are provided solely as a resource and a convenience to you. Such hyperlinks to other sites are not an endorsement by FAO, IUCN or UNEP of those sites. Neither FAO, IUCN nor UNEP makes any warranty, either express or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or content of such information, text, graphics, and hyperlinks. Neither FAO, IUCN nor UNEP has tested any software located on other sites and they make no representation as to the quality, safety, reliability or suitability of such software.

Under no circumstances shall FAO, IUCN or UNEP, or their affiliates or licensors be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, punitive, or consequential damages that result in any way from your use, non-use or reliance upon the Data, or that result from mistakes, omissions, interruptions, deletions, errors, or defects in the Data, or delays in their operation, transmission or failure of performance.

5. Indemnification. You agree to defend, indemnify and hold FAO, IUCN and UNEP, and their affiliates harmless from any and all damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including attorneys' fees, related to any violation of this Agreement by you or any authorized users of your account.

6. Termination. Either you or FAO, IUCN or UNEP may terminate this User Agreement at any time, effective immediately, with or without prior notice to the other party. Termination of this Agreement automatically terminates your license to use ECOLEX and any content or other material contained therein. The provisions of Section 4, 5, 7 and 8 shall survive any termination of this User Agreement.

7. Governing Law; Disputes. This User Agreement shall be governed by general principles of law, to the exclusion of any single national system of law. Any dispute, controversy or claim arising under or pursuant to this User Agreement shall be settled by mutual agreement. If the Parties are unable to reach agreement on any question in dispute, either party shall have the right to request arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the United Nations Commission on International Trade Law. The Parties agree to be bound by any arbitration ruling rendered in accordance with the above, as the final adjudication of any such dispute. Nothing contained in or related to this User Agreement shall be deemed a waiver, express or implied, of the privileges and immunities of FAO, IUCN or UNEP.

8 Miscellaneous. This User Agreement and any FAO, IUCN and UNEP policies relating to your operation and use of ECOLEX constitute the entire agreement and understanding between FAO, IUCN, UNEP and you with respect to the subject matter hereof. The provisions of this User Agreement shall inure to the benefit of FAO, IUCN, UNEP and its third-party content providers and licensors. No waiver by any party hereto of any of the provisions hereof or of any breach or other default hereunder shall be deemed to be a waiver of any preceding or subsequent breach or default.

fields.name: about
fields.body_en:
Why FAO, IUCN and UNEP?

A bit of history

IUCN Environmental Law Centre (ELC) created a comprehensive information system on environmental law (ELIS) in the 1960's. ELIS, which was one of the first computerized legal information system, evolved into a large set of references to treaties, national legislation, soft law and legal literature, linked to documents held in the libraries of the ELC for the IUCN Environmental Law Programme. It continues to be one of the main assets of the capacity building activities of the IUCN Environmental Law Programme, as well as a constant source of expertise for the work of the Programme in the fields of law development, technical assistance, and expertise building.

While FAO was established in 1945, it draws on the legacy of the Institute of International Agriculture (IIA), which was founded in 1905 to collect and publish statistical information on farming and agricultural products. FAO’s core mandate has always included the collection, analysis, interpretation and dissemination of information relating to nutrition, food and agriculture and, in 1948, the functions and assets of the IIA were transferred to it. FAO has, in this way, been committed to the collection and dissemination of legal and policy instruments on food, agriculture and natural resources management for more than 70 years. From 1954 to 1994, the FAO Legal Office published “Food and Agricultural Legislation”, an annual compilation of significant, innovative and illustrative legislation. In 1995, this publication was replaced by FAOLEX; a global, open access, database of national legislation, policies and bilateral agreements in areas relevant to FAO’s mandate. FAOLEX is constantly being updated (with an average of 8,000 new entries per year) and currently contains legal and policy materials drawn from more than 200 countries and regional economic integration organizations, of which the key elements have been summarized in English, French or Spanish based on original texts in over 40 languages. FAOLEX complements the technical support for legislative and regulatory reform provided to the FAO Member States by the Development Law Service of the FAO Legal Office.

UNEP has over the years contributed the collection of jurisprudence and case law to the ECOLEX Portal. UNEP furthermore provides information decisions and resolutions by the governing bodies of Multilateral Environmental Agreements (MEAs).

InforMEA (www.informea.org) is the flagship of the MEA Information and Knowledge Management (MEA-IKM) Initiative, which comprises of over 20 Secretariats of Multilateral Environmental Agreements (MEAs) administered by 4 UN entities and IUCN and supported by the European Union. While the ECOLEX section containing COP decisions has been developed with the support of the European Union the contents of this portal are the sole responsibility of the ECOLEX partners and can in no way be taken to reflect the views of the European Union.

The Initiative seeks to harmonize data standards across MEA Secretariats to allow for easier and more cost-effective development of information and knowledge tools. The InforMEA Portal compiles decisions and resolutions of the Conferences/Meetings of Parties (COP/MOP), semantically analyzed treaty text, ratification data and focal point information, national reports and national implementation plans and a joint MEA calendar.

InforMEA further provides an E-learning tool offering self-paced and free introductory courses on MEAs and International Environmental Law and Conventions and LEO – the InforMEA Thesaurus of term concepts governing this area of international law (learn more >).

To join forces and combine the strength of the three organizations therefore made eminent sense, and while cooperation in this field between UNEP and IUCN was firstly mandated by the Governing Council of UNEP in 1995, it is in 2001 that a partnership Agreement was signed by FAO, IUCN and UNEP for the integration of their data, and of FAOLEX into ECOLEX.

The resulting combined information resource is the largest available on environmental law globally, with over hundred thousand references to relevant documents already being available on the web.

fields.name: privacy
fields.body_en:
Privacy Statement

 

FAO, IUCN and UNEP are committed to protecting your privacy and developing technology that gives you the most powerful and safe online experience. This Statement of Privacy applies to the ECOLEX Web site and governs data collection and usage. By using the ECOLEX website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement.

Collection of your Personal Information

ECOLEX collects information about your computer hardware and software that is automatically provided to the ECOLEX server. This information can include: your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times and referring Web site addresses. This information is used by ECOLEX for the operation of the service, to maintain quality of the service, and to provide general statistics regarding use of the ECOLEX Web site.

Please keep in mind that if you directly disclose personally identifiable information or personally sensitive data through ECOLEX public message boards, this information may be collected and used by others. Note: ECOLEX does not read any of your private online communications.

ECOLEX encourages you to review the privacy statements of the Web sites you choose to link to from ECOLEX so that you can understand how those Web sites collect, use and share your information. ECOLEX is not responsible for the privacy statements or other content on Web sites outside of the ECOLEX sites.

Use of your Personal Information

ECOLEX does not have any pages requesting from you any sensitive personally identifiable information. You may communicate with ECOLEX partners by e-mail. In this case ECOLEX collects and uses your personal information to operate the ECOLEX Web site and deliver the services you have requested. ECOLEX also uses your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from ECOLEX and its affiliates. ECOLEX may also contact you via surveys to conduct research about your opinion of current services or of potential new services that may be offered.

ECOLEX does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties. ECOLEX may, from time to time, contact you on behalf of external business partners about a particular offering that may be of interest to you. In those cases, your unique personally identifiable information (e-mail, name, address, telephone number) is not transferred to the third party. In addition, ECOLEX may share data with trusted partners to help us perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries. All such third parties are prohibited from using your personal information except to provide these services to ECOLEX, and they are required to maintain the confidentiality of your information.

ECOLEX does not use or disclose sensitive personal information without your explicit consent.

ECOLEX keeps track of the Web sites and pages our customers visit within ECOLEX, in order to determine what ECOLEX services are the most popular. This data may be used to deliver customized content and advertising within ECOLEX to customers whose behavior indicates that they are interested in a particular subject area.

ECOLEX Web sites will disclose your personal information, without notice, only if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on ECOLEX or the site; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of ECOLEX; and, (c) act under exigent circumstances to protect the personal safety of users of ECOLEX, or the public.

Use of Cookies

The ECOLEX Web site uses "cookies" to help you personalize your online experience. A cookie is a text file that is placed on your hard disk by a Web page server. Cookies cannot be used to run programs or deliver viruses to your computer. Cookies are uniquely assigned to you, and can only be read by a web server in the domain that issued the cookie to you.

One of the primary purposes of cookies is to provide a convenience feature to save you time. The purpose of a cookie is to tell the Web server that you have returned to a specific page. For example, if you personalize ECOLEX pages, or register with ECOLEX site or services, a cookie helps ECOLEX to recall your specific information on subsequent visits.

You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most Web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline cookies, you may not be able to fully experience the interactive features of the ECOLEX services or Web sites you visit.

Security of your Personal Information

As mentioned, ECOLEX does not have any pages requesting from you your user Id, password and/or any sensitive personally identifiable information. ECOLEX partners sites or the sites found by the search may have such pages. It is your responsibility to check in each specific case if the pages secure your personal information from unauthorized access, use or disclosure.

Changes to this Statement

ECOLEX will occasionally update this Statement of Privacy to reflect customer feedback. ECOLEX encourages you to periodically review this Statement to be informed of how ECOLEX is protecting your information.

Contact Information

ECOLEX welcomes your comments regarding this Statement of Privacy. If you believe that ECOLEX has not adhered to this Statement, please contact ECOLEX at ECOLEX@iucn.org. We will use commercially reasonable efforts to promptly determine and remedy the problem.

fields.name: knowledge_tools
fields.body_en:
You might be also interested in these websites:

Protected Areas Law

This project represents a collaboration between the IUCN Environmental Law Centre, the IUCN World Commission on Environmental Law, and the IUCN Academy of Environmental Law, working with the World Commission on Protected Areas, the IUCN Global Protected Areas Programme, and IUCN regional offices for Eastern and Southern Africa (ESARO), West and Central Africa (PACO), and Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean (ORMACC). It is generously supported by the Aage V. Jensen Charity Foundation.

Protected Areas Law website

Law for Sustainability

This project represents a collaboration between the IUCN Environmental Law Centre, the IUCN World Commission on Environmental Law, and the IUCN Academy of Environmental Law. It is generously supported by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ).

This project forms part of the larger initiative to develop a Natural Resource Governance Framework, led by the IUCN Commission on Environmental Economic and Social Policy.

Law for Sustainability website

Water Law & Governance Support Platform

The Water Law and Governance Support Platform (WLGSP) offers legal expertise and ad hoc technical support on water governance issues in transboundary basins.

Water Law & Governance Support Platform

Mesolex

This database has been designed as a regional platform ECOLEX. Here you will find updated information related to environmental governance instruments that affect natural resources information.

Mesolex website
